page.title: 06SOUTH CERNEY LEISURE (2)
page.content: The Village Hall is used by a wide variety of clubs and societies for their meetings. It is rarely used, though, for parties and dances, because the noise has disturbed neighbours in the past. Old people and young mothers are well catered for by village societies. The Women's Institute is popular amongst women of all ages. Men are more likely to attend the Gardening Club. South Cerney has its own magazine, called "Cerney News". This lists many forthcoming meetings and has a small ads section. It rarely makes reference to young people's activities, though. For indoor sports activities, it is necessary to travel to Cirencester. There is a football pitch in Cerney, but there are no public tennis courts.
